summary:
Dynamic procurement professional with a proven track record of over thirteen years in Global food companies, pharmaceutical/biopharma organizations, and technology leader Microsoft. Proven track record in driving operational efficiency, optimizing vendor relationships, and delivering strategic procurement solutions for business growth.

Key Skills: 
Procurement and Vendor Management: Strategic sourcing, contract negotiations, and supplier relationship management. Proficient in SAP, APO, and Oracle procurement systems.
Supply Chain Optimization: Production control, demand planning, logistics, and global inventory management.
Leadership and Collaboration: Team management, cross-functional collaboration, and successful project outcomes.
Regulatory Compliance and Quality Assurance: Knowledge of industry regulations, quality assurance practices, and compliance across the supply chain.
Multilingual Proficiency: Fluent in Portuguese, English, and Spanish, with basic Italian.
Advanced Technology Proficiency: Excel (macros, pivots), SharePoint, PowerPoint, Word, Microsoft Power BI.

education.field_of_study: Honors Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration (Level 8)

projects.title: Assigment Human Resource - Case of Racism
projects.description:
To conduct an investigation into a serious staff grievance.
To support the investigation with examination the organisation grievance, disciplinary and conflict resolution procedures and analyse their effectiveness in resolving the grievance under investigation.
Find a consideration of relevant employment legislation by the Ireland Employment Legislation.
To do some recomendations to the manager and Human Resource Department.

projects.title: Business Administration - The Organisation
projects.description:
To select an Organisation and ivestigate and analyse the structure and functions of this organisation.
Conclusions and recommendations with my own opinion on the efficiencies and inefficiencies of the organisation and how they affect its perfomance.

courses.name: International Exchange Program in General English

profile_positions.description:
As Global Category Manager for External Manufacturing and Sourcing, I managed seamless technology transfer and drove innovation and operational excellence. Collaborated cross-functionally for flawless knowledge transfer, production scale-up, and compliance. Transformed category performance.

• Developed and execute a global category strategy to drive cost savings, enhance supplier performance, and foster innovation in external manufacturing.
• Built and maintained strong supplier relationships, negotiating favourable terms, and ensuring compliance with quality standards and service level agreements.
• Drove cross-functional collaboration with Global Innovation, Global Quality Assurance, Regulatory Affairs, and Supply Chain teams in North America, LATAM and EMEA to align external manufacturing activities and achieve business objectives.
• Proactively identified and mitigated risks, ensuring uninterrupted supply, quality assurance, and regulatory compliance.
• Monitored category performance, analyze metrics, and deliver reports to senior management, highlighting achievements, challenges, and opportunities for improvement. 
• Utilized key performance indicators (KPIs) such as cost savings, supplier performance metrics quality metrics, and innovation milestones to measure category performance and track progress toward goals.
• Lead strategic initiatives for external manufacturing and sourcing, optimizing supplier selection, capacity utilization, and overall supply chain efficiency.
• Managed tech transfer processes to ensure successful knowledge transfer from external manufacturing partners to internal, manufacturing, facilitating seamless production scale-up and maintaining product quality and integrity.
profile_positions.title: Global Category Manager - External Manufacturing & Innovation

profile_positions.description:
The Senior Manager Supplier Relationship was responsible to oversee and manage the strategic & long-term business relation with contract manufacturing organizations (CMOs). The SRM also provided strategic insights to the Senior Leadership (Sr Directors) to drive and influence long term decisions such as: selection of new CMO’s, evaluating the technologies and capabilities withing the CMO networking, to support the future pipeline.

•	Developing and managing the strategic relationships and interactions between Alexion and its CMOs to ensure the execution of long-term Supply Plan is in place to deliver interrupted supply of commercial and clinical product.
•	Negotiating long-term manufacturing capacity to meet the needs of the Demand Supply Plan – 3 to 5 years.
•	Developing and maintaining good relationship with internal groups (primarily Strategic Supply Chain, Demand Planning, Quality Assurance, Tech Transfer Services, New Product Introduction and Finance) and co-ordinate cross functional activities to provide support to CMO’s ensuring timely executions are met.
•	Managing Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Price (RFP) with existing and new CMO’s. 
•	Directing and influencing CMO’s to identify and implement cost savings, cycle time reduction and driving process improvements. Developing and implementing strategies to mitigate long term supply risks. 
•	Managing CMO’s strategic negotiations, executing CMO’s transition, consistently updating contracts, and negotiating contract phasing out. 
•	Leading Alexion cross functional strategic team meetings (including CMO resources) to support various project activities such as Tech Transfers, Qualification and Validation of new CMO and New Product Introduction.
profile_positions.title: Senior Supplier Relantionship Manager

profile_positions.description:
Centrient Pharmaceuticals is the global business-to-business leader in sustainable, enzymatic antibiotics, next-generation statins and anti-fungals. We produce and sell intermediates and active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), as well as our own tablets, capsules and other finished dosage forms.
Responsible: for the effective management of globally launches for Finish Dosage Formulas (FDF) business. Making Cross-functional alignment (Commercial, RA, QA, Procurement, Artwork, Master Data and Serialization and external Vendors). Being the   Single Point of Contact for any NPL topics that might delay the launch, compromise the budget and business strategies. 
•	Working closely with Commercial, Regulator Affairs and Procurement to secure the Global Launches are aligned. 
•	Managing regular cross function New Product Launch Meetings with external Vendors, Customers and key internal stakeholders to monitor launch status. 
•	Driving innovation using advance Excel and PowerBi to create data bases to quickly extract information and take decisions. 
•	Managing monthly NPL Meetings with suppliers to share launches plan, drive communication and business improvements.
•	Engaging & influencing cross function teams (RA, QA, Procurement, Sales & Marketing, Artwork, Master Data and Serialization) to effective resolve conflicts and challenges that may influence launches and priorities.
•	Managing and resolving conflicts that may influence the launch plan with key internal stakeholders, Customers and Vendors. 
•	Designing and implementing continuously launch process improvement to ensure effective reporting on business target achievement, using PowerBi dashboards and advanced excel. 
•	Effectively reporting on time Launches, monthly KPI’s and mitigation plans to Chief Commercial Officer.
profile_positions.title: New Product Launch Manager

profile_positions.description:
Perrigo is a leading provider of over-the-counter health and wellness solutions that enhance individual well-being by empowering consumers to proactively prevent or treat conditions that can be self-managed.

Portfolio: Responsible for 3 main categories with products sold in Europe, Australia and Brazil, manufactured across 15 CMO's.  
•	Responsible for the supplier relationship of external CMO partners in relation to key strategic categories for the business.
•	Ensured CMO sites were fully aligned to the strategic initiatives of the category including supply plan, technical transfer and product launch initiatives.
•	Managed all communications with CMO partners including driving quarterly business reviews with key internal stakeholders. 
•	Ensured compliance and ethical standards were achieved at all times.
•	Aligned with local affiliates on key priorities working through the SIOP process to understand and mitigate any supply constraints.
•	Provided clear communication regarding supply interruptions including contingency planning for external supply base.
•	Supported internal manufacturing sites in relation to tech transfers to CMO partners, NPI introduction to markets and supply constraints. 
•	Single point of contact in the organization - connecting key internal departments (Sr Procurement Planners, Quality, External CMO’s, Artwork, Innovation Manager, Stage Gate Managers and Sourcing Managers). 
•	Identified and engaged the right stakeholders to create ownership of the relationship and aligned business strategic objectives.   
•	Drove innovation using PowerBi to create CMO data base to collect and analyze and extract information to identify opportunities and present results to management.
•	Created and maintained SOP’s for the signed product portfolios.
profile_positions.title: Supplier Relationship Manager (Over The Counter and Medical Devices Products)

profile_positions.description:
Achievements & Improvements: Responsible for 16 projects and improvements in the department of 20 people (Supplier Relationship Managers and Senior Procurement Planners). Such as: Optimized production files decreasing time for updates and errors – using advanced excel and SAP reports; Created standards across the chain (Long term Forecast increased from Quarter to Yearly – reduced challenge with raw material; Improved demand forecast accuracy – working closely with USA customer service team to gather information and priorities; Created seasonal Production files for United Kingdom Planners, to monitor stock level, to be presented to Managers and Directors of Perrigo; Created Dashboards using Power BI ( Supplier Performance and Stock coverage); Organized Production meeting to review and engage 3rd Vendors. Power BI introduction to Perrigo Dublin. 
•	Worked and Engaged with USA customer service and commercial team, to gather information and priorities. 
•	Lead and Implemented Production and QA reports to trace information of: deviations and releasing time.
•	Managed the monthly demand reconciliation, reviewing and reporting the relevant KPIs to commercial Managers.
•	Monitored all activities necessary to achieve timely launch, e.g. artwork initiation, SAP updates, Forecast and Demand. 
•	Held regular meetings with Vendors and internal team members to identify the best strategy to improve communication, highlight main challenges, manufacturing downtime, production output, line efficiency and QA releases/rejections. 
•	Aligned with Commercial directors and customer service managers to prioritize supply of strategic customers.  
•	 Streamlined interactions between internal and external stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Senior Procurement Planner

profile_positions.description:
Achievements: Communication improvements across the region with focus in the big markets (China, Japan, Australia and New Zealand); improved of demand and forecast accuracy; monthly meeting with main stakeholders to review and present results such as sales performance and demand accuracy; improved relationship & communication with 3rd vendors in Netherlands and United Kingdom through regular meetings and understanding of the needs to engage the team and focus on improvements and streamline the business partnership. 
•	Worked with teams across APOC (Asia, Pacific, Oceania and Greater China), improving communication and relationship.
•	Improved relationship & communication with Vendors across Europe and China.  
•	Generated, presented and tracked monthly consensus Forecast of all PC Hardware product (3500 single products). 
•	Developed and implemented Dashboards through PowerBi to track KPI’s and 
•	Managed the monthly demand reconciliation review with strategic commercial teams, reporting on the relevant KPIs, assumptions and risks contained in the demand plan. 
•	Engaged with Vendors in Europe to improve the relationship and secure supply of goods avoiding out of stock. 
•	Built and maintained effective working relationship with key stakeholders across US, Europe and Asia, Pacific, Oceania and Greater China.  
•	Monitored and managed key commercial targets to influence continuous improvement within local countries.
•	Held daily contact with two External Vendors in Nederland and United Kingdom. To discuss production updates, long term forecast and streamline the interactions.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Regional Planner - Contract

profile_positions.description:
Kepak is a family-owned, future-facing company, Founder Noel Keating opened the Keatings butcher shop in 1966. Over 3,000 employees, across 30 countries, delivering prime cuts of fresh meat and Over 20,000 farms and farming families.
Achievements: Projects finished on time and exceeded expectations – there was not delays starting the production and no shortages to customers and orders. SOP created and approved through BRC audit; improved timing of inbound and dispatches – trucks and vendors were calling 24h earlier to schedule the delivery and send the paper work.  

•	Responsible for evaluating, analyzing and presenting sales and supply chain data to Commercial Manager. Working on strict weekly KPI such as Stock rotation, Stock holding, Shelf Live and Sales accuracy.

1.	New Packaging Facility project – August 2015 to December 2015 – Facility certificated with BRC standards. 
•	Sourced and ensured packaging availability in place to meet key time lines of the project. 
•	Coordinated annual Demand for bulk components – Suppliers in Brazil and Thailand. 
•	Held weekly meetings and conference calls with Quality Control, Project Engineer and Commercial 
•	Planned and executed seasonal strategies for existing and new Products; Created Introductions and Forecasts; Designed playbook and staff training. 

2.	Warehouse Standard Operating Procedure – December 2015 to March 2016 
•	Developed the SOP's that describes all the procedures of Loading, Unloading, Temperature, Inventory Management and Safety Food. 
•	Coordinated with technical department to ensure the work had the best standards and traceability.
•	Created standards SOP’s according to BRC certification - issue 7.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Project Implementation

profile_positions.description:
•	Coordinated daily pulse meeting with Factory Manager, Quality Manager, Supply Chain Manager and Logistic Manager. Presented daily output, sales orders, stock level and production priorities-Burger King & Quick France.
•	Monitored Stock levels – securing Company had enough stock to meet demand –  max 2.5 weeks cover.
•	Provided Production and Demand Plan with 10 weeks in advance. Monitored Sales Forecast and Sales Accuracy.
•	Generated monthly documents and reports for strategy meetings. Worked with the various team members to ensure that business requirements were being met on all development activities.

Implementing new ways of working to automate the reports and training new staff.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Trainee - Contract

profile_positions.description:
Pili Hidráulicos, Brazil

Founded in 1979 in Rio Grande do Sul-Brazil, the company Pili Hydraulics Ltd provides services for hydraulic and pneumatic equipment, being a pioneer in performing services for collection and delivery to customers.

•	Purchased stock of spare parts of Hydraulic material (bearings, seals, connections, stainless steel, galvanized sheets, tubes, hydraulic motors and pneumatic hoses and terminals. Spent: $300,000 to $500,000.
•	Reduced number of suppliers, revised contracts (strategic supplier selection, revised the payment terms).
•	Improved supplier reliability and relationship. 
•	Sourced and developed dual Suppliers for key materials (stainless steel and tubes). 
•	Created and implemented SOP’s for Buyer Processes and Order Quotation.
